title: Han Sang-woon
text:
Han Sang-Woon (; born 30 May 1986) is a South Korean <a href="Association%20football">football</a> <a href="forward%20%28association%20football%29">forward</a>, who plays for <a href="Busan%20IPark">Busan IPark</a> in <a href="K%20League%202">K League 2</a>.
Career.
He joined <a href="Busan%20I%27Park">Busan I'Park</a> by <a href="K-League%202009">2009 K-League draft</a>. He scored 2 goals at 23 appearance in his first season. In the <a href="K-League%202011">2011 season</a>, he showed better performance than his previous seasons and made many impressive goals. He scored 9 goals and had 7 assists at 28 appearances in this season.
On 30 December 2011, he moved to <a href="Seongnam%20Ilhwa%20Chunma">Seongnam Ilhwa Chunma</a> from his first professional club Busan.
International career.
Han was called <a href="South%20Korea%20national%20football%20team">national team</a> in <a href="2014%20FIFA%20World%20Cup%20qualification%20%28AFC%29">2014 WCQ match</a> against <a href="Lebanon%20national%20football%20team">Lebanon</a> (2 September 2011) and <a href="Kuwait%20national%20football%20team">Kuwait</a> (6 September 2011) but didn't play the games.
